Module it.polimi.ingsw
Package it.polimi.ingsw.client.view.GUI

Class GUI

java.lang.Object
javafx.application.Application
it.polimi.ingsw.client.view.GUI.GUI
All Implemented Interfaces:
View
public class GUI extends javafx.application.Application implements View
Represents the graphical user interface of the application.

    • getCurrentScene

      public SceneName getCurrentScene()
      Retrieves the current scene name. This method returns the name of the current scene in the application. The scene name represents the currently active scene or screen displayed to the user.
      Returns:
      The current scene name.

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      The main entry point of the JAVAFX application. This method is called when the application is launched. It initializes and starts the application. It is responsible for setting up the initial configuration and launching the application's user interface.
      Parameters:
      args - The command-line arguments passed to the application.

      Parameters:

      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs during the TCP connection setup.

    • getGamesList

      public void getGamesList()
      Retrieves the list of games from the server. This method uses the sender to request the game list from the server.

    • refreshGameList

      public void refreshGameList(List<LocalGame> games)
      Refreshes the game list in the FindGameController with the provided list of games. This method is used to update the UI with the latest game list.
      Parameters:
      games - The list of games to be displayed in the UI.

    • addFirstPlayer

      public void addFirstPlayer(String name, GameMode gameMode, int numPlayer)
      Adds the first player to create a new game with the given name, game mode, and number of players. This method uses the sender to send the necessary information to the server. After adding the first player, it switches the stage to the CREATE_GAME scene.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the player.
      gameMode - The game mode chosen for the new game.
      numPlayer - The number of players for the new game.

    • joinGame

      public void joinGame(String name, int gameId, boolean switchScene)
      Joins a game with the given name and game ID. This method uses the sender to send the join request to the server. If switchScene is true, it switches the stage to the JOIN_GAME scene.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the player.
      gameId - The ID of the game to join.
      switchScene - Indicates whether to switch the stage to the JOIN_GAME scene after joining.

    • joinLobby

      public void joinLobby()
      Attempts to join the lobby. If the current scene is not the lobby, it switches to the join game stage.

    • reconnect

      public void reconnect(String ID)
      Initiates a reconnection to a game with the specified ID.
      Parameters:
      ID - The ID of the game to reconnect to.

    • initLobby

      public void initLobby()
      Initializes the lobby by calling the init() method of the LobbyController. This method is used to set up the lobby scene and start the lobby functionality. It also invokes the timerRoutine() method to initiate periodic tasks.

    • updatePlayerList

      public void updatePlayerList(ArrayList<LocalPlayer> list, Command command, String playerName)
      Updates the player list in the lobby with the provided list of players. This method is used to display the updated player list in the lobby UI. It also shows a notification message indicating if a player joined or left the game.
      Parameters:
      list - The list of players to be displayed in the UI.
      command - The command indicating the action (JOIN or QUIT) performed by the player.
      playerName - The name of the player who joined or left the game.

    • getPlayers

      public ArrayList<String> getPlayers()

    • timerRoutine

      public void timerRoutine()

    • quitGame

      public void quitGame()
      Quits the game by leaving the current game and switching the stage to the QUIT scene. This method uses the sender to notify the server that the player is leaving the game. It then switches the stage to the QUIT scene using the switchStage() method.

    • updateBoard

      public void updateBoard()
      Updates the game board in the UI by invoking the showBoard() method of the GameController. This method is used to reflect changes in the game board on the client side.

    • updateHand

      public void updateHand()
      Updates the hand of the current player in the UI by invoking the showHand() method of the GameController. This method is used to display the updated hand of the current player.

    • updateBookShelf

      public void updateBookShelf(LocalBookshelf bookshelf)
      Updates the bookshelf display in the UI by invoking the showBookshelf() method of the GameController. This method is used to update the bookshelf representation on the client side.

    • updateGlobalNotifications

      public void updateGlobalNotifications(NotificationsType notificationsType, String name, Coordinates coordinates, ArrayList<Integer> list, int column)
      Updates the global notifications in the UI by invoking the showGlobalNotification() method of the GameController. This method is used to display various game-related notifications to all players.
      Parameters:
      notificationsType - The type of notification to be displayed.
      name - The name of the player associated with the notification.
      coordinates - The coordinates related to the notification.
      list - The list of integers associated with the notification.
      column - The column number associated with the notification.

    • updateExceptionNotification

      public void updateExceptionNotification(String e)

    • updateTableView

      public void updateTableView()
      Updates the table view in the UI by invoking the showTableView() method of the GameController. This method is used to update the display of the table view in the game.

    • updateTokens

      public void updateTokens()
      Updates the tokens in the UI by invoking the showTokens() method of the GameController. This method is used to update the display of tokens in the game.

    • updateEndGameToken

      public void updateEndGameToken()
      Updates the end game token in the UI by invoking the showEndGameToken() method of the GameController. This method is used to display the end game token in the game.

    • pickItem

      public void pickItem(Coordinates coordinates)
      Sends a request to pick an item at the specified coordinates to the server by invoking the pickItem() method of the sender. This method is used when a player wants to pick an item from the game board.
      Parameters:
      coordinates - The coordinates of the item to pick.

    • undoPick

      public void undoPick()
      Sends a request to undo the pick of an item. This method is used when a player wants to undo the pick of an item from the game board.

    • putItemList

      public void putItemList(int column)
      Sends a request to put an item list in the specified column to the server by invoking the putItemList() method of the sender. This method is used when a player wants to put an item list in the table view column.
      Parameters:
      column - The column number where the item list will be put.

    • selectInsertOrder

      public void selectInsertOrder(ArrayList<Integer> positions)
      Sends a request to select the insert order of the hand to the server by invoking the selectInsertOrder() method of the sender. This method is used when a player wants to select the order in which the item list will be inserted.
      Parameters:
      positions - The list of positions indicating the insert order.

    • setTurn

      public void setTurn(String name)
      Sets the turn of the current player in the UI by invoking the setTurn() method of the GameController. This method is used to indicate which player's turn it currently is.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the player whose turn it is.

    • leaveGame

      public void leaveGame()
      Sends a request to leave the game to the server by invoking the leaveGame() method of the sender. This method is used when a player wants to leave the game.

    • updateChat

      public void updateChat(ChatMessage chatMessage, String name)
      Updates the chat window with a new chat message by invoking the displayMessage() method of the GameController. This method is used to display a new chat message in the chat window.
      Parameters:
      chatMessage - The chat message to be displayed.
      name - The name of the sender of the chat message.

    • sendMessage

      public void sendMessage(String message, String receiver)
      Sends a chat message to the server by invoking the addChatMessage() method of the sender. This method is used to send a chat message to other players in the game.
      Parameters:
      message - The chat message to be sent.
      receiver - The name of the receiver of the chat message. If null, the message will be sent to all players.

    • updateEnd

      public void updateEnd()
      Updates the end game label in the UI by invoking the updateLabel() method of the EndController. This method is used to update the label displayed in the end game screen.

    • disconnectionHandler

      public void disconnectionHandler(String name)
      Handles a disconnection event for the current scene. If the current scene is the game scene, it updates global notifications with the DISCONNECT type.
      Parameters:
      name - The name associated with the disconnection event.

    • reconnectHandler

      public void reconnectHandler(String name)
      Handles a reconnection event for the current scene. If the current scene is the game scene, it updates global notifications with the RECONNECT type.
      Parameters:
      name - The name associated with the reconnection event.

    • leaveHandler

      public void leaveHandler(String name)
      Handles a leave event for the current scene. If the current scene is the game scene, it updates global notifications with the INACTIVE type.
      Parameters:
      name - The name associated with the leave event.
